did.unittitle: Giovanni Valentino Mattia Fabbroni papers, ca. 1770s-1875
did.abstract: This collection includes letters from, and drafts of letters to, scientists, artists, musicians, soldiers, political figures, and court personages throughout Europe, especially Italy and France. Topics covered range from personal and social affairs to agriculture, botany, geology, natural history, coinage, museum management, politics, weights and measures, current affairs. The collection also includes four diaries, housed separately with manuscript volumes.
did.physdesc: Ca. 8500 items. Includes four volumes housed with manuscript volumes in vault

arrangement.head: Arrangement note
arrangement.p: The index is an alphabetical listing of material and reflect the physical arrangement of the collection. The index is not complete. The collection is composed of folders which group letters by author, and some letters may not be listed.
Portions of the collection are composed of letters between Fabroni and Filippo Mazzei. This portion is given the call number addition ".m". This is visiable in the index.

odd.head: Early American History Note
odd.p: This Collection of Giovanni Fabbroni letters contain a range of correspondence that Fabbroni carried on with fellow scientists throughout Europe. Although much of Fabbroni’s travel and correspondence focused on Continental Europe, his wide-ranging correspondence can offer insight into the British Atlantic World and the flow of ideas and information within it.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition note
acqinfo.p: Received and accessioned, 1961. See in-house shelf list for additional accession dates and numbers.

bioghist.head: Biographical/Historical note
bioghist.p: Giovanni Valentino Fabbroni (1752-1822) was an Italian naturalist, agronomist, economist, and politician. He was a founder and vice director of the Natural History Museum in Florence and also served as director of the Mint of Tuscany. His varied activities included electrochemical experiments that helped pave the way for subsequent developments, most significantly the invention of the battery; studies in currency, including contributions to the creation of the metric system; and proposals related to agricultural and economic reform in Tuscany. Fabbroni maintained an extensive correspondence with a wide variety of individuals in Europe and the United States.

Little is known about Fabbroni’s personal life, including his upbringing and education; a hint that he may have come from less then favorable circumstances is provided by R. Lee who wrote in her Memoirs of Baron Cuvier (1833) that, “Like most of those who have attained great celebrity, the early years of M. Fabbroni were passed in struggle and difficulty.” He was born in 1752 in Florence, Italy, where he also spent most of his adult life. In 1775, he collaborated with Felice Fontana (1730-1805) in the founding of the “Imperiale e Regio Museo di Fisica e Storia Naturale,” a natural history museum. For the next thirty years, Fabbroni served as the museum’s vice director under Fontana, who was appointed its first director.

Fabbroni was an advocate of the chemical revolution of Antoine-Laurent Lavoisier (1742-1794, APS 1775) and at the museum, which had its own laboratory, he and Fontana conducted research in pneumatic chemistry and electrochemistry. One of his research interests concerned animal electricity, which had only recently been demonstrated by Luigi Galvani (1737-1798). Fabbroni proposed that galvanism may be due solely to chemical affinities, and that electricity could be generated only by the contact of dissimilar bodies when they reacted together chemically, differed in temperature, or were rubbed together. Fabbroni’s findings, which he presented before the Accademia dei Georgofili in 1793, set the stage for a favorable reception in 1800 of Alessandro Volta's (1745-1827) voltaic pile, the first battery that produced a reliable, steady current of electricity. Fabbroni’s ideas also influenced the work of Anthony Carlisle (1768-1842), William Nicholson (1753-1815) and Humphry Davy (1778-1829, APS 1810), who may have learned of them from translations of Fabbroni’s paper published in the Journal de physique (1799), the Journal of Natural Philosophy (1800), and the Philosophical Magazine (1800). Fabbroni also often assisted Grand Duke Peter Leopold (1747-1792), who conducted scientific experiments as a hobby.

In 1778 Fabbroni wrote the first of many letters to Thomas Jefferson. Jefferson had learned of Fabbroni from their mutual friend Philip Mazzei (1730-1816) as early as 1767, and he had encouraged the young man to move to Virginia to become music teacher and tutor to his children. Fabbroni evidently was inclined to accept the offer when the Duke of Tuscany selected him to travel through England and France to observe scientific and technological progress in each nation. Frabbroni accepted the Duke’s invitation, and while there is no evidence that he ever visited the United States, he subsequently corresponded with Jefferson on a variety of topics, including meteorology and music, which Jefferson famously described in a letter to the Italian as "the favorite passion of my soul.”

In 1778 Fabbroni traveled to England, where he recorded his observations in a series of diaries. During his stay in London he became acquainted with Benjamin Franklin as well as Richard Price (1723-1791, APS 1785), Joseph Priestley (1733-1804, APS 1785), Benjamin Vaughan (1751-1835, APS 1786), and other radicals, many of whom were members of the Club of Thirteen, an intellectual club founded in the 1770s. Fabbroni apparently attended some of their meetings and he also carried their letters and parcels to Paris.

In 1780 Fabbroni published in Paris his Reflexions sur l'état actuel de l'agricolture, in which he developed new techniques of agronomy and cultivation based on procedures of pneumatic chemistry. He suggested, for example, replacing crop rotation and tilling with a series of plants grown together. The book had a considerable impact on farming in Tuscany. More generally, Fabbroni's work contributed to the process of applying chemistry to study the plant world, which eventually developed into the disciple of agricultural chemistry.

In 1783 Fabbroni became a member of the Accademia dei Georgofili, a learned society dedicated primarily to the natural sciences and agricultural reform, and the following year he commenced work as its correspondence secretary, acting as the intermediary between the Accademia and the museum. In addition, the Tuscan government frequently called on Fabbroni to contribute plans and ideas toward the improvement of Tuscany’s economy, including the location of potentially lucrative coal deposits. The scholarly works he published during this period include essays on topics such as currency, economics, and government.

Fabbroni was influential in the development of the metric system and in its introduction to Italy. In the late 1790s the French government sought to establish a mass standard that would aid in the regulation of commerce. Fabbroni was selected as a member of a committee charged with determining the mass of a cubic decimeter of water. At the time the decreed definition of the kilogram specified water at 0°C, its highly stable temperature point. In 1799, after several years of research, Fabbroni and the French chemist Louis Lefèvre-Gineau (1751-1829) redefined the temperature at which water reaches maximum density as 4°C, as opposed to 0°C. Based on their calculations, a new Kilogram was manufactured and delivered to the Archives of the Republic. The prototype was ratified, and the new standard eventually stood for the next ninety years.

Overall, Fabbroni’s activities were unsually varied. Lee wrote in her biography of Fabbroni’s friend Georges L. C. F. D. Cuvier (1769-1832), who evidently penned an eulogy for Fabbroni, that “we find [Fabbroni], at one time, charged with delicate political missions; at others, with the direction and administration of the mint at Florence [1800]; seeking the causes of pestilence, and the means of prevention; making roads, fixing conductors for lightning, and aiding the state by his counsels.” His diverse interests are also reflected in Fabbroni’s long and varied list of correspondents, ranging from artists to soldiers, aristocrats to scientists, and politicians to economists. His correspondents include, for example, Davy, Mazzei, Cuvier, Priestley, Sir Joseph Banks (1743-1820), Johann Reinhold Forster (1729-1798, APS 1793), Alexander von Humboldt (1769-1859, APS 1804), Angelica Kauffmann (1741-1807), and the Marquis de Lafayette (1757-1834, APS 1781).
Fabbroni died in 1822 in Pisa, Italy.

scopecontent.p: [ca.]. A.L. 4p. Mutilated. (see Fabroni papers.) General scientific experiments, especially on electricity, phlogistine, willow plants, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L. 3p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Change of design of sculpture etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning geographical publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Milan, A.L. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rome, A.L.S.: James L. Macie. 2p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Thanks for his help. Volcanoes in Italy. Geology. Mineralogy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Lundi [Monday]. A.L.in 3rd.P.: Macie. 1p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Invitation to dinner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Monday Evening. A.L.in 3rd.P.: Macie. 1p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Asks to borrow publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wednesday. A.L.in 3rd.P.: Macie. 1p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Forwards parcel and invites him to breakfast.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Wednesday Evening. A.L.in 3rd.P.: Macie. 1p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Returns publication, and sends others to him. Concerning "ye enormous bag of crystals."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Friday. A.L.in 3rd.P.: Macie. 1p. (see Fabroni papers.) Invitation to dinner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Vendredi [Friday]. A.L.in 3rd.P.: Macie. In French. 1p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Invitation to dinner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Saturday. A.L.in 3rd.P.: Macie. 1p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Invitation to breakfast.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Samedi Matin [Saturday morning]. A.L.in 3rd.P.: Macie. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Noticed an article about "des briques flottantes" made in imitation of those of the ancients.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Samedi soir [Saturday evening]. A.L.in 3rd.P.: Macie. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Invitation to breakfast.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sunday Evening. A.L.in 3rd.P.: Macie. 1p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Invites him to breakfast.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Sunday night. A.L.in 3rd.P.: Macie. 1p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Invitation to breakfast.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Florence, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Translation of a work. Mineralogy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Florence, A.L. in 3rd.P. 1p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Is sorry they cannot visit, but will give the items to Sir Joseph Banks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Siena, A.L.S.with initials. 3p. and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Good engineers are needed. He hopes to revisit Florence.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Siena, A.L.S.with initials. 3p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Says he is too modest and should speak out. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Siena, A.L.S.with initials. 3p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Asks specific questions about Tuscany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Venice, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Asks if he will correspond on scientific subjects.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Philadelphia, A.L.S. 2p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Praises De Crenis. Refers to Mazzei and Carlo Bellini.at William and Mary. Concerning Thomas Paine. Concerning the war. Refers to G. Washington.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: L.in 3rd.P. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Invites her to see some dancing.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning Mrs. Webster.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning recent publication from Bologna.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning a Milanese, Melzi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning Ottavio Malvezzi.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning Republican form of government

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning journals and institutes in Italy under Napoleon. Refers to Lacépède.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning Antoine Cagnoli and his activities.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Local news and friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Pietro Malvezzi. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Refers to Banks. Concerning publications which should be printed in Italy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Dr. Nischouski, of University of Vilna, who is interested in medicine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Scientific academies.

did.unittitle: Letter to Signora Teresa Fabroni, Florence;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning her husband and the academy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Galvanism.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning natural science. Refers to Galvani and the Institute of Bologna.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces a Polish prince who wishes to meet famous scientists.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Florence. A.L.S. 3p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning his publications on medicine

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Hopes to see him at a mutual friend's house. Refers to Fontana.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (See Fabroni papers.) Business of the Societá patriotica di Milano. On same sheet is: Societá Patriotica di Milano. Programma...[1792?].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Milano, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning publications.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Milano, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni Papers.) Geology and drilling.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Milano, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Recommends a man recommended by Fontana

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Milan, A.L.S. 3p. In Italian. (see Fabroni Papers.) Scientific news.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pisa, A.L.S. 2p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Hopes to return to Florence. Has met and enjoyed knowing Mazzei. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p. and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Will forward things to Deuchy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Printed D.filled in in ms.S.: G. Lanci. 1p. Seal. In Latin. (see Fabroni papers.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leghorn, A.L.S. 3p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning Jefferson and his works, which should be translated into Italian.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leghorn, A.L.S. 1p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Will forward pamphlet to Jefferson. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Modena, A.L.S. 4p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning a work for publication which he has prepared for Fabroni. Honored by Fabroni's friendship.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Modena, A.L.S. 4p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Explains lost letter. Cattle disease in the lowlands.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Modena, A.L.S. 4p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning a manuscript for Fabroni. Concerning a De Vinci manuscript. Speaks of Bergolli Modanese. Cattle disease.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Modena, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Forwards chest of best bologna of Modena and hopse he enjoys it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 4p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Sympathizes in his troubles. Concerning publishing Aristotle.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Modena, A.L.S. 6p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Advises treatment for Fabroni's son and wife. Friendly letter. Concerning his own study of topography.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Modena, A.L.S. 3p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Mail has increased, so larger parcels should be sent, more infrequently. Sends certain copies of work.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Modena, A.L.S. 2p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Forwards requested parcel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p.and add. In Italian (see Fabroni papers.) Thanks for publications and praises them.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.D.S. 2p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.)

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, A.L.S. 1p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Invitation to dinner.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, 3 Thermidor an 7 A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Fabroni, identifies him, and authorizes him to carry things through customs.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 3p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Cannot acquire Rheum for Favi. Thanks for publications on botany. Concerning tests on air.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soho Square, A.L.S. 3p. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Sir Georges Staunton. Refers to Wedgwood. Sheep disease. Mineralogy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soho Square, A.L.S. 3p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Cannot give names of seeds forwarded. Botany. Lists publications wanted. Concerning Fontana and Scheele.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 3p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Botanical news. Sends seeds. Herbarium of Linnaeus is in England.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soho Square, A.L.S. 4p.,add. (see Fabroni papers.) Thanks for books and orders additional parts. Botany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soho Square, A.L.S. 2p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Mr. Wedgwood, son of Josiah.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soho Square, A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. (see Fabroni Papers.) Believes the government shout prohibit importation of certain vegetables. Thanks for publications. Refers to Wedgwood and his thermometer.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soho Square, A.L.S. 4p.,add. (see Fabroni papers.) New plant is really new, differs from all others. Concerning his brother. Experimental medicine on hydrophobic patient Botany. Wishes another publication. Asks for description of a furnace.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soho Square, A.L.S. 3p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Thanks for report on Lathyrus. Seeds from Chile. Refers to Wedgwood.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, A.L.S. 3p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Leopoldo is now a member of the Royal Society of Antiquities. Botany. Thanks for books. French Revolutions is stopping scientific research.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soho Square, A.L.S. 3p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Botany. Has not received books by Mr. John Wedgwood. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p.and add.,end, (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Mr. Johnson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 4p.,add.,end. (see Fabroni papers.) Thanks for books. Concerning publications. Peale in Europe. Botany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning scientific instruments sent his friends. Galvini's experiments in England. Volta's experiments. Electricity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soho Square, A.L.S. 2p. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Sir Charles Blagden.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soho Square, A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. (see Fabroni papers.) French Revolution has stopped philosophical research in England. Gold in Ireland Refers to Blagden. Meteorites.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Soho Square, A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end. (see Fabroni papers.] Thanks for his publication on animal electricity sent by Blagdon. Thanks for the Society of Antiquities for his works. Asks for specimen of plants.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 3p.and add., end. (see Fabroni papers.) ----Translations in Italian. 4p. Meteorites. Macropodidae.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, A.L.S. 3p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Botany. Astronomy and Herschel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Overton in Derbyshire, A.L.S. 4p.,add. (see Fabroni papers.) Anger over disease imported from Africa to Italy in botany. Forwards seeds. Refers to the Royal society.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning metals and crystals and comparisons with Fontana.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning his seal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Siena, A.L.S. 1p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Forwards publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Siena, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning their publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L. in 3rd.P. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Asks favor. Refers to Sir Joseph Banks and Thunberg.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Thanks for books on mineralogy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Thanks for volumes on mineralogy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Liveorno, 30 Floreal an 9 []. L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Comments on official affairs. Refers to Gregoire.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, A.L.S. 5p.and add. In French and English. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning the names, Pele, Pelle, Pella, and Pal, and possible locations, from ancient sources.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, L. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Will ship goods at the first opportunity.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, L. 1p.and add.,end. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning the shipment of his order.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpelier, Printed L.filled in in ms.S.with letter of 2p.in handwriting.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Notifies him of new name of the company Shipment of sulphuric acids.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Tartaric acid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 2p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning the shipping of orders.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 5p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Acids. Cannot furnish him with nitric acid. Sulphuric acids. Ether.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 3p.and add.and enc.of 1p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Will ship him the acids. Regrets he cannot furnish nitric acid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 3p.and add.and enc.of 1p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning the making and shipping of various acids. Hopes to sell him nitric acid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Notifies him of changes in price of wine and nitric acid.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 2p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Forwards packages containing nitric acid, ect. Botany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 2p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Shipments of nitric acid and payment for them. Botany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, L. 2p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Notifies him of a shipment and of the price of it.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, L. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Botany. Work at the Paris mint.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 3p.and add.with 2p.enc. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Notifies him of shipment and when it may be delivered.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Events have prevented his purchasing cypress trees(?).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Can furnish all the nitric acid he will need, in the event of war. Botany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Montpellier, A.L.S. 2p.and add. End.by. G.Fabroni(?) In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning the making of nitric acid, in Italy, and the possibility of shipping it to him from France.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Wishes him well. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Are busy with the war and cannot visit. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Will visit him and wants him to know that no one believes the lies about him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Says that General Clarke still regards him highly and doesn't believe any of the accusations.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Reassures him of General Clarke's high regard and affection.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 3p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Tells him not to worry, that General Clarke is doing all he can. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) States that his friends are working for him [Fabroni]. Napoleon's plans for travel.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 3p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Notifies him of difficulties in sending things by post.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 3p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Business and shipments.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Plans for a trip. Route of Napoleon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Delighted everything is all right. Sorry to hear of the illness of his wife.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 2p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Delighted his wife is better. Asks for shipment of some bottles [of wine?].

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 2p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Asks that he purchase a straw hat and send it to Venice of General Clarke.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 2p.and add. in French. (see Fabroni papers.) Inquires about his wife. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Sends information from General Clarke. Is glad Signora Fabroni is better.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Directions for forwarding a parcel for General Clarke. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Perruggia, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Thanks him for his kindnesses.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rome, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Describes Rome. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.in 3rd.P. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning the royal gallery.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Florence, A.L.S. 3p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Comments on Priestley and his experiments on air. His praise of liberty. Remarks on European events.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, A.L.S. 3p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning abolition of capital punishment in Tuscany.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Note of advice.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning his political duties. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, A.L.S. 1p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Thanks for his letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 3p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Plans for travel. Publication. friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Alexandria, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Hopes to hear from him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Fabroni.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Fabroni. Refers to Fontana. Printed: Théococidès. Trois lettres inedites de Boscovich.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, A.L.S. 1p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Printed: Theódoridès. Trois lettres inédites de Boscovich.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: L. 1p. Incomplete. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Printed: Theódorides. Trois lettres inédites de Boscovich.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.in 3rd.p. 1p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Notifies him that the duke wishes to speak with him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: L. 3p. (see Fabroni papers) Concerning steam apparatus for minting money. On same sheet is letter from same to same; June 29, 1822.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note

scopecontent.p: Brussels, A.L.S. 1p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Notifies him of his election and promises to send his diploma.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: 2 Vendémiaire an 7 []. A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Greets him on his appointment to the commission on weights and measures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Brussels, 27 Brumaire an 7. A.L.S. 2p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Friendly letter concerning scientific works on geography, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: La Haÿe, A.L.S. 3p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Sympathizes with him over his loos, but assures him that all scientists recognize his worth. Thanks for gift.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning Degerando and Anisson.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Dr. Meckel, German naturalist.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Wants letters of introduction to men in northern Italy, where he goes to look for coal.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Is publishing a volume and wants an article from Fabroni. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Livorno, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) His plans for travelling. Still wants an article for publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pisa, A.L.S. 2p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Friendly letter. Is working on a publication on metallurgy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning a publication on metallurgy. Will pay postage when told how much.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: A.L.S. 2p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning various writers, including Hamilton in Naples, Macie [Smithson] and Priestley.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, 20 Frimaire an 11 A.L.in 3rd.P. 1p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Study of medicine in Italy.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Met his friends and wrote letters for them to Lyon.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, 1 Floreal an 10 []. A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Forwards his publication on weights and measures. Introduces two mineralogists

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning purchase of publications and forwards his publication.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, L.S. 1p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Jean Berruti and Mons. Grand.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces and recommends Anghilante.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning Anghilante, the museum of natural history, etc.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, A.L.S. 1p.and add.,end. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Thanks for the eloge on his wife. Friendly letter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Pisa, L.S. 2p.and add.,end. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning various publications, including Deleuze and agricultural societies. Concerning scientific questions in Turin.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, L.S. 1p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Mr. Dueg, a German painter.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Turin, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Speaks of a person who wishes to study with him.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, Printed L.filled in in ms.S. 2p. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning his knowledge and teaching of chemistry.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Paris, 19 Thermidor an 9. A.L.S. 2p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Thanks for botanical specimens from Italy. Praises him and says all his friends remember him in Paris.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Milan, A.L.S. 3p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning the institute.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Bologna, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning the institute.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reggio, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Presents copy of his work on geology.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Reggio, A.L.S. 2p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers. ) Concerning his Memoira and its distribution.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Milano, A.L.S. 1p.and add. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning his work on Galileo.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Modena, A.L.S. 2p. In Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning weights and measures.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Florence. A.L.S.with initials. 2p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Friendly letter and asks for certain publications. Delivered his parcel to Sir Joseph Banks.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Warfield, Berkshire, A.L.in 3rd.P. 1p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Notifies him that Fabroni and Fontana will visit: the plants "will exert their Powers to entertain such Guests."

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rome, A.L.S. 4p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Quotes letter of his father concerning apparatus for Fontana. Quotes letter of Priestley on air.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Rome, A.L.S. 4p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Quotes letter of his father concerning apparatus for Fontana. Quotes letter of Priestley on air.

did.unittitle: Letter to Sir Joseph Banks, London;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Etruria, A.L.S. 3p.and add.,end.in Italian. (see Fabroni papers.) Concerning borers ready to be shipped. Chemistry. Refers to Josiah.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Florence. A.L.S. 1p.and add. In French. (see Fabroni papers.) Friendly letter. Inquires about Fabroni.

did.unittitle: Letter to John Davidson, New Castle-upon-Tyne;

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: London, A.L.S. 2p.and add. (see Fabroni papers.) Introduces Fabroni and asks that he be shown the coal mines.

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Leghorn, A.L.S. 2p.,add. (see Fabroni papers.) Regrets difficulties with Great Britain prevents his return the America. Refers to Mazzei.
